definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: The hills and dales are stripped of mantles of snow.
sentences.chinese: 山岡和山谷脫去了積雪的斗篷。

sentences.english: I stood tip-toe upon a little hill.
sentences.chinese: 踮着腳，我站在小山岡上。

sentences.english: Than the least of the empty shells that strewed the area of grass of the hill.
sentences.chinese: 充其量不過是散佈在山岡草地上的空空的貝殼。

sentences.english: Low hills provide the backdrop as views seawards extend into infinite blue.
sentences.chinese: 在山岡的映襯下，無邊無際的藍天向大海延伸。

sentences.english: He was still standing on the hummock piping the fife in the long dusk.
sentences.chinese: 依然拿着橫笛站在山岡上，把黃昏吹得悠長。

sentences.english: We walked down the hill before sunset.
sentences.chinese: 我們在日落前走下山岡。

sentences.english: The low, brownish-ocher mountains continued for hundreds of miles.
sentences.chinese: 褐赭色的山岡延綿數百英里不斷。

sentences.english: On meadow, the hill and the shore.
sentences.chinese: 在草原山岡和岸邊四處搜尋。

sentences.english: It stands on a hill to the east of the river.
sentences.chinese: 它位於河東岸的一個山岡上。

sentences.english: The sun was rising over the hills.
Every valley shall be filled in, every mountain and hill made low.
sentences.chinese: 一切山窪都要填滿，大小山岡都要削平。

sentences.english: My wellbeloved hath a vineyard in a very fruitful hill
sentences.chinese: 我所親愛的有葡萄園，在肥美的山岡上。

definition: Changbin or Changpin township in Taitung County 臺東縣|台东县[Tai2 dong1 Xian4], southeast Taiwan
Yukawa (name)/YUKAWA Hideki (1907-1988), Japanese theoretical physicist and Nobel laureate
Yamaguchi prefecture in southwest of Japan's main island Honshū 本州[Ben3 zhou1]
ODA Nobunaga (1534-1582), Japanese shogun (warlord), played an important role in unifying Japan
Sendai, capital of Miyagi prefecture 宮城縣|宫城县[Gong1 cheng2 xian4] in northeast Japan
